trips.name: Nainital
trips.description: Experience the best of Uttarakhand with this Nainital and Jim Corbett itinerary. Spot wildlife during jeep safaris in Corbett National Park, relax in comfortable resorts, and explore the hill station charm of Nainital—from iconic lakes and trails to local markets. The journey includes pleasant drives, cultural temples, and memorable landscapes, making it perfect for adventure and nature lovers.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Transfer to Jim Corbett
activities: Meet the representative and transfer to Corbett National Park (5–6 hours).
Evening leisure time or optional jungle activities.

itinerary.title: Morning & Evening Jungle Safari in Corbett
activities: Early morning jeep safari into Corbett National Park for wildlife spotting (tiger, elephant, deer, etc.).
Afternoon at leisure or optional activities.
Evening jeep safari or free time.

itinerary.title: Transfer from Corbett to Nainital
activities: Evening walk at Mall Road or boat ride at Naini Lake.

itinerary.title: Local Sightseeing in Nainital
activities: Visit Snow View Point, Naina Devi Temple, and Tiffin Top.
Enjoy a boat ride on Naini Lake.
Evening at leisure in the town.

itinerary.title: Departure from Nainital
activities: Check out and departure for Dehradun/Rishikesh/Haridwar for onward journey.

trips.name: Mussoorie
trips.description: Soak up the old-world charm of Mussoorie—explore colonial landmarks, waterfalls, and panoramic mountain views. This itinerary is designed for those who love nature trails and lively hill town vibes.

itinerary.title: Hill Town Arrival & Mall Road
activities: Reach Mussoorie by morning, check-in to hotel.
Begin sightseeing with Gun Hill via ropeway.
Stroll along Mall Road—enjoy cafes and colonial architecture.
Sightseeing at Christ Church and Company Garden.
Evening at Camel’s Back Road for sunset views.

itinerary.title: Waterfalls & Landmarks
activities: Excursion to Kempty Falls—enjoy the cascading water and scenery.
Short visit to Lal Tibba for panoramic Himalayan views.
Explore George Everest’s House or Jharipani Falls, time permitting.

trips.name: Rishikesh
trips.description: Experience the thrill and tranquility of Rishikesh with this 2-day adventure itinerary. Discover white water rafting, serene yoga by the Ganges, sacred temples, and mesmerizing evening Ganga Aarti. Ideal for quick getaways that blend adventure, spirituality, and stunning Himalayan views.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Adventure Activities
activities: Check-in to hotel/camp; freshen up and breakfast.
Go river rafting from Shivpuri/Marine Drive to Rishikesh (adventure grade rapids).
Try cliff jumping, body surfing, and beach volleyball.
Relax at the riverside or indulge in yoga/meditation.
Evening Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat.
Explore local cafes and the Laxman Jhula area.

itinerary.title: Sightseeing & Departure
activities: Morning yoga/meditation session by the Ganga.
Visit iconic attractions: Laxman Jhula, Ram Jhula, Beatles Ashram.
Shopping at Rishikesh markets for souvenirs.

trips.name: Haridwar
trips.description: Immerse yourself in the spiritual aura of Haridwar. Witness sunrise prayers, take a holy dip in the Ganga, and experience the iconic Ganga Aarti—blending devotion, tradition, and the bustle of temple town life.

itinerary.title: Temple Town Arrival
activities: Visit Har Ki Pauri for a holy dip in the Ganga.
Walk through the bustling markets and temples (Mansa Devi by cable car, Chandi Devi).
Enjoy street food and local sweets.
Witness evening Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri.

itinerary.title: Spiritual & Local Exploration
activities: Early morning prayers or yoga by the river.
Visit Bharat Mata temple and Daksha Mahadev temple.
Explore Sapt Rishi Ashram or Kali Temple.
Depart after lunch or in the evening.

trips.name: Dehradun
trips.description: Discover Dehradun's green charm with a quick trip to its famous caves, monasteries, and vibrant markets. This itinerary combines nature, history, and local flavors for an ideal weekend escape.

itinerary.title: Arrival and Local Sights
activities: Visit Robber's Cave (Guchhupani) for a walk in the cool streams.
Explore Mindrolling Monastery—marvel at the stupa and gardens.
Stroll through Paltan Bazaar for local shopping.
Evening walk and sunset at Sahastradhara.

itinerary.title: Nature & Culture
activities: Morning at Forest Research Institute (FRI) for architecture and museum tour.
Visit Tapkeshwar Temple along the riverside.
Relax at Lachhiwala Nature Park—or enjoy a short hike nearby.

trips.name: Tungnath & Chandrashila
trips.description: The Chopta Chandrashila Trek offers an unforgettable adventure into the serene landscapes of Uttarakhand. This moderate trek takes you through lush meadows, forests, and alpine settings, leading to the summit of Chandrashila Peak at 13,000 feet, offering stunning views of the Himalayan ranges. The trek also passes the Tungnath Temple, the highest Shiva temple in the world, adding a spiritual dimension to the journey. Nearby attractions include Ukhimath, the winter residence of Lord Kedarnath, Kalimath Temple, and Deoria Tal Lake, known for its reflective waters and panoramic mountain views. For wildlife enthusiasts, the Kanchula Korak Deer Musk Sanctuary is a must-visit. Easily accessible from Delhi, the trek can be reached by road, train, or air. The cost of the trek typically ranges between ₹7,500 and ₹9,500 per person, covering transportation, accommodation, meals, and guides. The best time to go is from April to June or during winter (October to February) for a snowy experience. This package ensures a smooth experience with professional guides, comfortable accommodations, and a well-organized itinerary, making it ideal for both beginners and experienced trekkers looking to connect with nature and spirituality.

itinerary.title: Arrival and Drive to Chopta
activities: Reach Chopta from Delhi via road or other transport.
Settle into accommodation and prepare for trek tomorrow.

itinerary.title: Trek to Tungnath and Chandrashila
activities: Trek from Chopta to Tungnath Temple (highest Shiva temple in the world).
Continue trek to Chandrashila Peak at 13,000 feet.
Enjoy panoramic Himalayan views from Chandrashila.
Return to Chopta or nearby accommodation.

itinerary.title: Exploration and Nearby Attractions
activities: Visit Ukhimath, the winter residence of Lord Kedarnath.
See Deoria Tal Lake famous for its reflective waters and mountain views.
Option to visit Kanchula Korak Deer Musk Sanctuary for wildlife enthusiasts.

itinerary.title: Departure
activities: Depart from Chopta and return to Delhi or onward destination.
Chauli Ki Jaali cliff walk at sunset
Jhula Devi Temple & Chaubatia orchards tour
Short trek to Khaliya Top or local herbs farm

trips.name: Kedarnath
trips.description: Embark on a spiritual and adventurous journey from Rishikesh to Kedarnath. This pilgrimage trek combines the sacred vibes of the Himalayas with breathtaking landscapes, covering holy temples, mountain trails, and serene ashrams. The itinerary includes a mix of trekking, sightseeing, and relaxation, making it suitable for devout travelers and nature lovers alike.

itinerary.title: Arrival & Rishikesh Exploration
activities: Arrive at Rishikesh and check into the hotel.
Visit local attractions like Laxman Jhula and Ram Jhula.
Attend Ganga Aarti in the evening at Triveni Ghat.

itinerary.title: Drive to Sonprayag and Trek to Gaurikund
activities: After early breakfast, drive from Rishikesh to Sonprayag (approx. 8–9 hours).
Reach Sonprayag and proceed by short trek or pony ride to Gaurikund.
Check in at guesthouse; rest and prepare for the Kedarnath trek.

itinerary.title: Trek to Kedarnath Temple
activities: Begin the 16 km trek from Gaurikund to Kedarnath.
Enjoy the stunning Himalayan scenery en route.
Visit Kedarnath Temple and participate in prayers.

itinerary.title: Explore Kedarnath & Return Trek
activities: Morning visit to local sights like Bhairavnath Temple.
Begin descent trek back to Gaurikund.

itinerary.title: Drive Back to Rishikesh
activities: Drive from Gaurikund/Sonprayag back to Rishikesh.
Relax and enjoy evening at leisure.

trips.name: Valley of Flowers
trips.description: Experience the magic of the Valley of Flowers, a living rainbow of over 500 species of rare Himalayan flowers. This beginner-friendly trek includes stays in cozy lodges, guided trails through lush valleys, reaching the sacred Hemkund Sahib at 14,100 ft. Explore the spiritual and natural highlights with expert guides in a safe, structured, and unforgettable adventure.

itinerary.title: Arrival at Rishikesh and Travel to Joshimath
activities: Arrive at Rishikesh and settle into the spiritual vibe.
Drive to Joshimath, visit Narasimha Temple, and prepare for the trek.

itinerary.title: Drive to Govindghat and Trek to Ghangaria
activities: Drive to Govindghat, the trek starting point.
Trek from Govindghat to Pulna, then to Ghangaria.
Enjoy scenic trails and natural beauty during the trek.

itinerary.title: Explore Valley of Flowers
activities: Trek through the blooming Valley of Flowers National Park.
Experience flora, fauna, and breathtaking scenery.
Return to Ghangaria for overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Trek to Hemkund Sahib
activities: Trek to the sacred Hemkund Sahib at 14,100 ft.
Experience the serene glacial lake and Gurudwara.
Return to Ghangaria for overnight stay.

itinerary.title: Return to Rishikesh
activities: Drive to Rishikesh or onward destination.
Delhi → Haridwar → Neelkanth Mahadev trek start
Depart Delhi early morning → reach by noon
Evening Mall Road & Naina Devi Temple visit
Cable car to Snow View Point
Stroll Mall Road & Gun Hill ride
Depart Delhi → reach Rishikesh by afternoon
Check-in & evening Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
Check-in & temple visits (Mansa Devi, Chandi Devi)
Trek Chopta → Tungnath temple → Chandrashila summit

Evening Mall Road & Naina Devi Temple visit
Cable car to Snow View Point
Stroll Mall Road & Gun Hill ride
Depart Delhi → reach Rishikesh by afternoon
Check-in & evening Ganga Aarti at Triveni Ghat
Check-in & temple visits (Mansa Devi, Chandi Devi)
Trek Chopta → Tungnath temple → Chandrashila summit
